page.title: 10St Mary's Churchgate St
page.content:
There are 31{lime trees}lining the churchyard paths, separated by approximately ten paces. Some trees are missing. Most were planted around 1850. No trees were planted or felled in 1985.
{Ash, sycamore, beech}(the tallest), {copper beech, yew, hawthorn}and some{ {flowering trees}are in the main churchyard.
One{flowering cherry}was planted in memory of Violet Mary Howarth (1943 - 1980). Some new trees have been planted with bequests.
{John Cooper}trims the trees each February to keep them a reasonable size. For six years{Percy Pavett,}Old Age Pensioner, has kept the churchyard tidy.
